oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Votes for Women a Success (p. 4 of 4)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Votes for Women a Success (p. 4 of 4). Southern States Woman Suffrage Conference. No Date. Lizzie Crozier French Papers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Women's suffrage; Voting; Ephemera;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
SOUTHERN STATES WOMAN SUFFRAGE fCONFERENCE. Declaration of Principles.
The following resolutions were unanimous- ly adopted on Suffrage Day by the Southern States Woman Suffrage Conference: "Whereas, woman suffrage is a world movement now conceded as inevitable; and, "Whereas, 9,000,000 women in the indus- tries of this so-called republic need the ballot for protection as much as the workingmen need it, demonstrating thereby that woman suffrage is no longer a theory to be debated, but a condition to be met; and, "Whereas, there are but two ways of se- curing this extension of suffrage to women, through a national amendment to the Consti- tution or through the State submitting to the voters the question; and, "Whereas, we believe suffrage is a State right, and not a Federal right, and that the best interests of the nation will be conserved by preserving to the State the right to de- fine its electorate; be it "Resolved, That we women of the South, guided by the lessons of the past, do affirm | our faith in self-government, not alone for in- dividuals, but in self-government for the State, as the greatest constitutional heritage which, in the wisdom of the framers of our government, was chosen to insure a free man and a free State as the central ideals of de- mocracy; be it further "Resolved, That the time has come for the Democratic Party, the State rights party, to record itself in favor of 'Votes for Women,' and to this end we, the men and women of the South, consecrate our best efforts to make the party so record itself." SOUTHERN STATES WOMAN SUFFRAGE CONFERENCE Headquarters: 301 CARONDELET ST. NEW ORLEANS, LA.
